utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay, she is the star of the play. And she is my girlfriend! I get to have sex with the star of the play!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: People can hear you.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I know!!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Wow! She looks great. Doesn’t she?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Kathy
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: That is one good looking man!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Is it just me, or can you actually see his abs through his overcoat?!

utterance.speaker: Kathy
utterance.content: No, you’re my first. Put the money on the table.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Dude!

utterance.speaker: Kathy
utterance.content: If you want it to be.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Here’s your girlfriend’s button.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, hey, Mon, do you still have your like old blouses and dresses from high school?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah, I think I have some around here somewhere. Why?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, it’s just that maternity clothes are so expensive.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey, Rach! I made a pile of your stuff over on this side of the room. If you could just……throw your purses at it.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Bloomingdale’s eliminated my department.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh my God, are you out of a job?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No, but they stuck me in personal shopping. Which is just a huge step down!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Personal shopping? What is that? Like where you walk around with snooty rich people and tell them what to buy?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Uh-huh.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: That sounds great!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Umm, excuse me, we switched apartments. You can’t eat are food anymore, that-that gravy train had ended.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: There’s gravy?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: If you have the big apartment you have to deal with people coming over all the time. That fridge has got to be stocked, okay, that’s your department now.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I think I left a donut up here.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ooh! How was Kathy’s play?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, Kathy gets half-naked and simulates sex with a real good lookin’ guy.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah, it’s like someone literally wrote down my worst nightmare and then charged me $32 to see it!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: That’s a good idea for a business!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I’m totally screwed. Okay, they are gonna be hot and heavy on stage every night, and then they’re gonna go to their cast parties and he’s gonna try to undermine me. Y'know it’ll be like, "So where’s your boyfriend, what’s-his-name, Chester?" And she’ll go, "No-no-no, it’s Chandler." And he’ll go, "Whatever. Ha-ha-ha-ha!"

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: That-that is a good trick.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: All right, look, look, what am I gonna do?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Chandler, look they’re actors. They’re there to do a job, just ‘cause they work together, doesn’t mean they’re gonna get together. I mean just ‘cause it happened with Susan Sarandon and Tim Robbins, it doesn’t mean it’s gonna happen with them.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh-oh, Alec Baldwin and Kim Basinger.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Tom Cruise and Nicole Kidman.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey, Mel Gibson and Clint Eastwood.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: They’re not a couple!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh-okay, I get the game now.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay look, look, let me ask you a question, when they were doing it on stage, was it like really hot?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh yeah!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well okay, so then you’re fine. The rule is when two actors are actually doing it off-stage all the sexual tension between them is gone. Okay? So as long as it’s hot onstage you got nothing to worry about. It’s when the heat goes away, that’s when you’re in trouble.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Look, you guys have been to every play I’ve ever been in, have I ever had chemistry on stage?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Noooo!!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: So uh, man, are you gonna go to the play with me tonight?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Y’know what, I don’t know how comfortable I am going to see how hot the sex is between some guy and your girlfriend.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah, I know but…

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh no-no-no, I’m there.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey Mon! Want some pancakes?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You made pancakes?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yep! Grab a plate.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No-no, stay right there. Gettin’ closer.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay, okay, but don’t worry, because we also have cereals, muffins, waffles, and, jams, jellies, and marmalades. Which I’m fairly certain are the same thing.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Listen also we’re uh, we’re watching the game here Saturday night, if people want to come over.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh yeah!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, I was thinking about having people over for the game.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh yeah, who’s playing?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: The players.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Somebody seems to be missing being the hostess.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Please, it’s a relief is what it is, is what it is.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: All right Pheebs, stick out your plate!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Monica, I’m quitting! I just helped an 81 year old woman put on a thong and she didn’t even buy it! I’m telling you I’m quitting! That’s it! I’m talking to my boss right now! Yes I am! Yes I am! Yes I am! Yes I am! Yes I am! Yes I am! Okay bye, call me when you get this message. Oh! Mr. Waltham, I ah really need to talk to you.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Waltham
utterance.content: In a moment, please, I’m in the middle of a task. And you have a customer.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: Joshua
utterance.content: Hi, I’m Joshua.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hi, I’m Rachel Green. What can I do for you Joshua?

utterance.speaker: Joshua
utterance.content: Well, I need a whole new wardrobe. My wife, well my ex-wife…

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, I’m so sorry.

utterance.speaker: Joshua
utterance.content: Anyway, she burned all of my clothes. I got away with two things. This suit and what turned out to be a skirt.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, at least that’s a great suit.

utterance.speaker: Joshua
utterance.content: Yeah, but it wasn’t much fun dropping it off at the dry cleaners in the skirt. So I need everything down to underwear, so if you’re willing, I’m all yours.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Waltham
utterance.content: Rachel, you needed to speak to me?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No-no, that wasn’t me! Well, we should get started. Let me show you my underwear. The selection of underwear we carry.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh-oh, sorry, it’s this way, it’s this way.

utterance.speaker: Joshua
utterance.content: It’s this way? Sorry.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I’m right! Right? There was like no chemistry between them. Before they had heat, and now there’s no heat! Now you know what this means, Joey told us what this means!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: All right, let’s not jump to any conclusions. All right? There was some sexual chemistry between them.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Come on, it was like cousins having sex up there!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Here she comes. Don’t say a word, okay? Just be cool, don’t be…y'know you.

utterance.speaker: Kathy
utterance.content: Hey you guys!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Kathy
utterance.content: Hi! Thank you so much for coming again. Did you like it tonight?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, absolutely!

utterance.speaker: Kathy
utterance.content: Wasn’t Nick funny when he couldn’t get his match lit?

utterance.speaker: Kathy
utterance.content: It’s a good play, isn’t it?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, I loved the play. You were great, and Nick ditto. Clearly you’re having sex with him.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay, I…

utterance.speaker: Kathy
utterance.content: Clearly, I’m having sex with him?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh come on, it was so obvious! There was no chemistry between you two!

utterance.speaker: Kathy
utterance.content: Okay, so let me just get this straight. You’re accusing me of cheating on you, and insulting my performance?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Y’know, I-I could see how this could happen, y'know you’re up there every night, you’re naked, touching, kissing.

utterance.speaker: Kathy
utterance.content: Acting! Chandler, this is my job! I’m-I’m playing a part in a play! How can you not trust me?!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, you can understand, given how we started.

utterance.speaker: Kathy
utterance.content: Oh, wow. I can’t believe you’re throwing that in my face.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, that is what happened, and I don’t even see you denying this!

utterance.speaker: Kathy
utterance.content: I’ll tell you what, Chandler, why don’t you call me when you grow up!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah, well, don’t expect that to happen anytime soon!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I have the best job in the entire world! The most adorable guy came over today, and I got to dress him up all day!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Rachel has a new doll.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, I wish he was a doll, then I could get a Rachel doll and bump them together and make kissy noises. Oh! And he has the most beautiful name, I never realised it, Joshua! Josh-u-a! Joshua! Josh.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Uh, hello!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hi-e!!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ooh, what do I smell?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I don’t know, it smells good.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Fresh cookies! Hot from the oven!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ooh!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Please, have some!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, yumm!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah, I’ve just been fiddling around in here making delicious treats for everyone.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Wow! The new Playboy!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah, it’s just something I picked up.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Cookies and porn, you’re the best mom ever!!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: What? What?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, it was just something Josh said about v-necks, but you had to be there.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah, how does Jason look in a v-neck?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: It’s Joshua.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, whatever.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Wait! Wait! This isn’t take-out!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, I hate to eat and run, but…

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No, wait, please don’t go! I’ve got porn for you too!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, I don’t need it.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: People are supposed to wanna hang out here!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Why? Honey, what is the big deal?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I’m the hostess! Not those guys! I’m always the hostess! I mean, I was always the hostess, I mean even when I was little, I mean the girls brought their dollies to my tea party, I-I served the best air.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, why did you make like a whole big thing out of y'know, everyone has to hang out in the big apartment?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: ‘Cause they took our apartment, I wanted to punish them. But I’m-I’m done now. They’ve suffered enough.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: If you wanted to punish them, you should’ve just made them hang out here!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, that’s true.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: All right then, when I’m done with this place, it’s gonna be ten times better than that place!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, are we gonna trash that place?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Steps! Slut! You will all be very happy to hear that Kathy is sleeping with that guy!

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: What?!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: So you were right?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I confronted her, and she didn’t deny it! I don’t live here!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Chandler!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Chandler, what did she say?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Wait a minute.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Come here.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Are you sure?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, I may be drunk, but I know what she said! Then I went over to Beefsteak Julie’s…

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Beefsteak Charlie’s?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yes! See you and I have always been like—

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Whoops. Oh, hey, do you need help with that?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Nah, I got it.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ooh, I just feel bad, I never vacuum.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: So I was with Joshua for an hour today, and he has not asked me out. It’s just so frustrating!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Why don’t you ask him out?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, yeah, totally! That’s such a turn-on!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Really? It doesn’t seem desperate?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh-ooh, that’s the turn-on.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: He just got a divorce right?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hmm-mmm.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: So he’s probably really nervous around women, y'know? Maybe, you just have to make the first move.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah but, I’ve never asked a guy out before.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: You’ve never asked a guy out?!!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No. Have you?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Thousands of times!! That doesn’t make me sound too good does it?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I don’t even know how I would go about it.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh-oh-oh-oh, how I do it is, I look a woman up and down and say, "Hey, how you doin’?"

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, please!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey, how you doin’?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You know what, I’m gonna do that, I’m gonna call him up, and I’m gonna ask him out. I can do that. Ask him out. How you doin’? Hi! Joshua? It’s Rachel Green from Bloomingdale’s. Yeah, umm, I was wondering if you umm, if you umm, left your wallet at the store today? Well, we found a wallet, and we— the license? Well, that is a good idea! Uh, well, let’s see here this says this license belongs to a uh, uh, belongs to a mister uh, Pheebs, and umm, yeah, so sorry to bother you at home. I’ll see you tomorrow. Bye. You’ve done that a thousand times?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I’ve never done that.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ohh, God, I just got so nervous that he would say no.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well, you gotta give him something that he can’t say no too. Like uh, Knicks tickets! Invite the guy to a Knicks game, you’re guaranteed he’ll say yes!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Really?! You think that will work?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Absolutely! And if it doesn’t, can I get the extra ticket?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What the heck is that?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Did she call?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No, sorry.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: All right, maybe I should call her.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No! Forget her, man! You don’t need her, you don’t need that!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: He’s right, what she did was unforgivable.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, yeah, but y'know, what-what if I was wrong?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: How might you be wrong?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well y'know, what if she didn’t actually sleep with the guy?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Dude, tell me she actually told you this.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: She did not have to tell me, I saw the play, and there was no heat. Back me up here, Ross!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: That’s all you’re basing this on?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: That’s not backing me up! Look, you said with the off-stage and the heat, and the onstage and the oy heat.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Whoa-whoa, that-that was just a theory! There’s a lot of theories that didn’t pan out. The lone gunman. Communism. Geometry.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh my God!!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Would you like to go to a basketball game with me? You know, its funny, basketball, because I happen to have tickets too… Umm, who likes the Knicks—

utterance.speaker: Joshua
utterance.content: What do you think?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh! Well, as a single woman, who is available, I think you look great!

utterance.speaker: Joshua
utterance.content: Huh. Yeah?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yep. Oh, yeah, look you great. Oh yeah. Yeah, this looks great. Umm, so you like it?

utterance.speaker: Joshua
utterance.content: I do. I do. I love it. In fact, I think I’m gonna wear it home.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Great.

utterance.speaker: Joshua
utterance.content: All right, thank you so much for all your help.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: Joshua
utterance.content: Well, I guess this is uh, I guess this is it.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah-eah-ha!

utterance.speaker: Joshua
utterance.content: Thanks. Maybe I’ll see in the spring, with the uh, y’know, for the uh, bathing suits.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh well, you don’t want to do that now?!

utterance.speaker: Joshua
utterance.content: Ah, that’s okay, thanks.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Joshua
utterance.content: Anyway, hopefully, I’ll see you around sometime.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Basketball!

utterance.speaker: Joshua
utterance.content: I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I uh, I have two tickets to the Knicks game tonight if you’re interested, just as a thank you for this week.

utterance.speaker: Joshua
utterance.content: Wow! That would be great.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Joshua
utterance.content: Yeah, that would be fantastic! My-my nephew is crazy about the Knicks! This is fantastic, thank you so much Rachel.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Waltham
utterance.content: Good morning.

utterance.speaker: Joshua
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: Kathy
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey. I just, I just wanted to come over to-to say that I’m sorry. Y’know? I know I acted like the biggest idiot in the world, and I can completely understand why you were so upset.

utterance.speaker: Kathy
utterance.content: Oh wow. I really wish you’d call me.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah, I know, I-I wish I had too, but y’know I-I think this is a good thing. Y'know? ‘Cause we’ve had our first fight, and now we can move on. Y’know, I know for me— Nick’s pants?

utterance.speaker: Kathy
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah. Well, I think our second fight is going to be a big one!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay, for next time, what do you say?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I have an extra ticket. An extra ticket. Not, two tickets, I have an extra ticket.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: So the first time you ask a guy out, he-he turns you down?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: He didn’t turn me down! He’s at the game isn’t he? I got the date, I’m just not on it!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay, it’s ready. Come on.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What’s ready?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Just come.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh my God!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Wow! Monica!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Great!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: This is beautiful!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh did you—what did you—did you work for two days straight?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Pretty much. So, what do you, what do you think of the floor?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I don’t know, it looks the same.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You used to have carpet.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh yeah!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: So I made snacks. Please, just hang out okay? I’m just gonna rest my eyes just a little bit.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Look, Mon, do you want us to uh, come back later?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh no-no-no, stay, stay, stay, just keep talking. I’m always the hostess.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: How’d it go?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, she wasn’t sleeping with him.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh good!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: She is now.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What are you saying?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I’m saying that she… is a devil woman! Y’know I mean you think you know someone and then they turn around and they sleep with Nick! Nick, with his rock hard pecs, and his giant man-nipples! I hate him, I hate her! Well, I don’t hate her, I love her. This is all my fault really.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: How? How is your fault?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Because, I-I should’ve called! Y’know if I had just called her after our big, stupid fight, she never would’ve gone out with Nick, and they would’ve ended up in bed together. I threw her at his man nipples!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Honey, this is not your fault, just because you guys had a fight, it does not justify her sleeping with someone.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, if-if she thought they were on a break…

utterance.speaker: Mr. Waltham
utterance.content: Rachel, one of your customers seems to have left his billfold. A Joshua Bergen.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Mr. Waltham
utterance.content: Will you call him?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yes! I will! Absolutely! Hello, Rachel. Hi, Joshua. I left my wallet here on purpose. Really? Yes, I just wanted to see you again. Oh, I’m glad. Rachel, I’d like to say something to you. Yes? How you doin’?
